meta.title: Operation of Angle of Repose Apparatus

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Angle of Repose Apparatus for determination of flow properties of pharmaceutical powders and granules by measuring the angle of repose.
sections.scope: Applicable to angle of repose measurement activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the apparatus is placed on a stable, level surface in a clean environment.
Verify that the funnel, stand, and base plate are clean and dry.
Assemble the apparatus by fixing the funnel on the stand at appropriate height.
Place a sheet of graph paper or plain paper on the base plate to facilitate measurement.
Adjust the funnel height to the standard distance (typically 10 cm) above the base plate.
Ensure the funnel stem opening is of appropriate diameter as per standard method.
Weigh an appropriate quantity of powder or granules (typically 50-100 g).
Close the funnel outlet using a finger or stopper temporarily.
Pour the powder sample into the funnel carefully.
Remove the stopper or finger to allow powder to flow freely through the funnel.
Allow the powder to form a conical heap on the base plate without disturbance.
Continue until all powder has flowed and a stable cone is formed.
Measure the height of the cone (h) from the base to apex using a scale or vernier caliper.
Measure the radius of the cone base (r) at multiple points and calculate average.
Calculate the angle of repose using the formula: tan θ = h/r or θ = tan⁻¹(h/r).
Perform triplicate measurements with fresh powder samples for reproducibility.
Calculate the mean angle of repose and standard deviation.
Clean the apparatus thoroughly after use to prevent cross-contamination.
Document all measurements, calculations, and observations in the analytical record.
precautions: Ensure powder is free-flowing and dry before measurement.
Avoid vibrations or air currents during cone formation that may affect results.
Maintain consistent funnel height for all measurements.
Use sufficient quantity of powder to form a stable and measurable cone.
Do not disturb the formed cone during measurement.
Perform measurements in a controlled environment with minimal humidity.
Clean the funnel between different samples to prevent cross-contamination.
Handle powders with care and wear appropriate PPE including mask and gloves.
Record environmental conditions like temperature and humidity as they may affect results.
